sentences.sContent: He lives just across the street from me.
We live only a few miles from the coast.
sentences.sCn: 我们住的地方离海边只有几英里远。

sentences.sContent: A rather odd family came tolive next door to us.
sentences.sCn: 有一户相当奇怪的人家搬到了我们隔壁。

sentences.sContent: As soon as I saw the place, I knew I didn’t want to live there.
sentences.sCn: 我一看到那地方，就觉得不想住在那儿。

sentences.sContent: We’re still looking for somewhere to live.
They’ve finally found a place to live.
sentences.sCn: 他们终于找到了住的地方。

sentences.sContent: Most seventeen-year-olds still live at home(= live with their parents ).
sentences.sCn: 17 岁的孩子大都还住在家里。

sentences.sContent: The house has 3,600 square feet of living space(= the areas of a house you live in ).
sentences.sCn: 这房子有3,600平方英尺的居住空间。

synos.tran: 活的；生动的；实况转播的；精力充沛的

phrases.pCn: 不会感到内疚，会心安理得的；自重
忍受；[口]承认；寄宿在…家；与…同居
住在外面；活过（某一段时间）
独自生活；一个人住；单独居住
vt. 隶属于；在…统治下生活
学无止境；活到老学到老；活得长，见识多；学到新事物

words.tran: 活泼的；生动的；真实的；生气勃勃的
活的；现存的；活跃的；逼真的
适于居住的；生活过得有价值的

trans.tranOther: if you live in a place, you have your home there
